infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: EKS control plane logging insufficient
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Amazon EKS control plane logging is not enabled for all log types
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Audit records may not be available during investigation

iacDescription.issue: Amazon EKS control plane logging is not enabled for all log types
iacDescription.impact: Audit records may not be available during investigation

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: EKS cluster has non-encrypted secrets at rest
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: EKS cluster secrets are not encrypted
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Set the `encryption_config` object with the relevant `provider` & `resources`.

remediation.cloudformation: Set the `Properties.EncryptionConfig` object with the relevant `provider` & `resources`.
remediation.terraform: Set the `encryption_config` object with the relevant `provider` & `resources`.

iacDescription.issue: EKS cluster secrets are not encrypted
iacDescription.impact: That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.
iacDescription.resolve: Set the `encryption_config` object with the relevant `provider` & `resources`.

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: AWS Security Group allows open egress
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: The inline security group rule allows open egress
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Open egress can be used to exfiltrate data to unauthorized destinations, and enable access to potentially malicious resources
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Set `egress.cidr_blocks` attribute to specific ranges e.g. `192.168.1.0/24`

remediation.cloudformation: Set `Properties.SecurityGroupEgress.CidrIp` attribute to specific ranges e.g. `192.168.1.0/24`
remediation.terraform: Set `egress.cidr_blocks` attribute to specific ranges e.g. `192.168.1.0/24`

iacDescription.issue: The inline security group rule allows open egress
iacDescription.impact: Open egress can be used to exfiltrate data to unauthorized destinations, and enable access to potentially malicious resources
iacDescription.resolve: Set `egress.cidr_blocks` attribute to specific ranges e.g. `192.168.1.0/24`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: EKS control plane logging insufficient
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Amazon EKS control plane logging is not enabled for all log types
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Audit records may not be available during investigation

iacDescription.issue: Amazon EKS control plane logging is not enabled for all log types
iacDescription.impact: Audit records may not be available during investigation

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: EKS cluster has non-encrypted secrets at rest
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: EKS cluster secrets are not encrypted
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Set the `encryption_config` object with the relevant `provider` & `resources`.

remediation.cloudformation: Set the `Properties.EncryptionConfig` object with the relevant `provider` & `resources`.
remediation.terraform: Set the `encryption_config` object with the relevant `provider` & `resources`.

iacDescription.issue: EKS cluster secrets are not encrypted
iacDescription.impact: That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.
iacDescription.resolve: Set the `encryption_config` object with the relevant `provider` & `resources`.

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container is running without liveness probe
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Liveness probe is not defined
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Kubernetes will not be able to detect if application is able to service requests, and will not restart unhealthy pods

iacDescription.issue: Liveness probe is not defined
iacDescription.impact: Kubernetes will not be able to detect if application is able to service requests, and will not restart unhealthy pods

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container or Pod is running without root user control
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Container or Pod is running without root user control
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Container or Pod could be running with full administrative privileges

iacDescription.issue: Container or Pod is running without root user control
iacDescription.impact: Container or Pod could be running with full administrative privileges

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container is running with writable root filesystem
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: `readOnlyRootFilesystem` attribute is not set to `true`
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Compromised process could abuse writable root filesystem to elevate privileges

iacDescription.issue: `readOnlyRootFilesystem` attribute is not set to `true`
iacDescription.impact: Compromised process could abuse writable root filesystem to elevate privileges

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container is running without memory limit
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Memory limit is not defined
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers without memory limits are more likely to be terminated when the node runs out of memory

iacDescription.issue: Memory limit is not defined
iacDescription.impact: Containers without memory limits are more likely to be terminated when the node runs out of memory

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container's or Pod's  UID could clash with host's UID
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: `runAsUser` value is set to low UID
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: UID of the container processes could clash with host's UIDs and lead to unintentional authorization bypass
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Set `securityContext.runAsUser` value to greater or equal than 10'000. SecurityContext can be set on both `pod` and `container` level. If both are set, then the container level takes precedence

remediation.kubernetes: Set `securityContext.runAsUser` value to greater or equal than 10'000. SecurityContext can be set on both `pod` and `container` level. If both are set, then the container level takes precedence
remediation.terraform: Set `security_context.run_as_user` value to greater or equal than 10'000

iacDescription.issue: `runAsUser` value is set to low UID
iacDescription.impact: UID of the container processes could clash with host's UIDs and lead to unintentional authorization bypass
iacDescription.resolve: Set `securityContext.runAsUser` value to greater or equal than 10'000. SecurityContext can be set on both `pod` and `container` level. If both are set, then the container level takes precedence

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container has no CPU limit
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Container has no CPU limit
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: CPU limits can prevent containers from consuming valuable compute time for no benefit (e.g. inefficient code) that might lead to unnecessary costs. It is advisable to also configure CPU requests to ensure application stability.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value

remediation.kubernetes: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value
remediation.terraform: Add `spec.container.resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value

iacDescription.issue: Container has no CPU limit
iacDescription.impact: CPU limits can prevent containers from consuming valuable compute time for no benefit (e.g. inefficient code) that might lead to unnecessary costs. It is advisable to also configure CPU requests to ensure application stability.
iacDescription.resolve: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container could be running with outdated image
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: The image policy does not prevent image reuse
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: The container may run with outdated or unauthorized image

iacDescription.issue: The image policy does not prevent image reuse
iacDescription.impact: The container may run with outdated or unauthorized image

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container is running without privilege escalation control
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: `allowPrivilegeEscalation` attribute is not set to `false`
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Processes could elevate current privileges via known vectors, for example SUID binaries

iacDescription.issue: `allowPrivilegeEscalation` attribute is not set to `false`
iacDescription.impact: Processes could elevate current privileges via known vectors, for example SUID binaries

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container does not drop all default capabilities
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: All default capabilities are not explicitly dropped
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers are running with potentially unnecessary privileges
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`

remediation.kubernetes: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`
remediation.terraform: Add `ALL` to `spec.container.security_context.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities to `spec.container.security_context.capabilities.add`, ensuring it also does not contain `ALL`

iacDescription.issue: All default capabilities are not explicitly dropped
iacDescription.impact: Containers are running with potentially unnecessary privileges
iacDescription.resolve: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: EC2 API termination protection is not enabled
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: To prevent instance from being accidentally terminated using Amazon EC2, you can enable termination protection for the instance
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Without this setting enabled the instances can be terminated by accident. This setting should only be used for instances with high availability requirements. Enabling this may prevent IaC workflows from updating the instance, for example terraform will not be able to terminate the instance to update instance type

iacDescription.issue: To prevent instance from being accidentally terminated using Amazon EC2, you can enable termination protection for the instance
iacDescription.impact: Without this setting enabled the instances can be terminated by accident. This setting should only be used for instances with high availability requirements. Enabling this may prevent IaC workflows from updating the instance, for example terraform will not be able to terminate the instance to update instance type

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Security group description is missing
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: The description field is missing in the security group
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Increases the security management overhead

iacDescription.issue: The description field is missing in the security group
iacDescription.impact: Increases the security management overhead

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Non-Encrypted root block device
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: The root block device for ec2 instance is not encrypted
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.

remediation.cloudformation: Set `BlockDeviceMappings.Encrypted` attribute of root device to `true`

iacDescription.issue: The root block device for ec2 instance is not encrypted
iacDescription.impact: That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Resource has public IP assigned
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: AWS resource could be accessed externally via public IP
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Increases attack vector reachability

iacDescription.issue: AWS resource could be accessed externally via public IP
iacDescription.impact: Increases attack vector reachability

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Default VPC resource detected
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Default VPC resources is being maintained
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Default VPC is designed to help get started with AWS, however dedicated VPCs are recommended for any production deployments

iacDescription.issue: Default VPC resources is being maintained
iacDescription.impact: Default VPC is designed to help get started with AWS, however dedicated VPCs are recommended for any production deployments

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: CloudWatch Log group retention period not set
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Amazon CloudWatch log group does not specify retention period
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Logs will be kept indefinitely and incur AWS costs
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Set `retention_in_days` attribute to required value, e.g. set `365`

remediation.cloudformation: Set `Properties.RetentionInDays` attribute to required value, e.g. set `365`
remediation.terraform: Set `retention_in_days` attribute to required value, e.g. set `365`

iacDescription.issue: Amazon CloudWatch log group does not specify retention period
iacDescription.impact: Logs will be kept indefinitely and incur AWS costs
iacDescription.resolve: Set `retention_in_days` attribute to required value, e.g. set `365`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: CloudWatch log group not encrypted with managed key
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: Log group is not encrypted with customer managed key
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Scope of use of the key cannot be controlled via KMS/IAM policies
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Set `kms_key_id` attribute with customer managed key id

remediation.cloudformation: Set `Properties.KmsKeyId` attribute with customer managed key id
remediation.terraform: Set `kms_key_id` attribute with customer managed key id

iacDescription.issue: Log group is not encrypted with customer managed key
iacDescription.impact: Scope of use of the key cannot be controlled via KMS/IAM policies
iacDescription.resolve: Set `kms_key_id` attribute with customer managed key id
